This is a simple API
More information: https://helloreverb.com
Contact Info: you@your-company.com

AddMatch

Up 
post /leagueManage/{leagueName}
A union representetive user adding match (leagueManageLeagueNamePost)
A JSON object contains the match details

Path parameters

leagueName (required)
Path Parameter — the name of the league

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body match (required)
Body Parameter — match added to database

Responses

201

New match has been added

204

no content

400

bad request

401

unauthorized client

403

client doesn't have access

404

user not found

500

server error
Up 
post /matches/{userName}
user adding match to favorites (matchesUserNamePost)
A JSON object contains the match details

Path parameters

userName (required)
Path Parameter — the userName

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body match (required)
Body Parameter — match added to database

Responses

200

user found

201

New match has been added to favorites

204

no content

400

bad request

401

unauthorized client

403

client doesn't have access

404

user not found

500

server error

Login

Up 
post /login
A new user is connected (loginPost)
A JSON object contains all the details

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body loginUser (required)
Body Parameter —

Responses

200

login successfuly

204

no content

400

bad request

401

unauthorized client

403

client doesn't have access

404

user not found

500

server error

Logout

Up 
get /logout
user is disconnected (logoutGet)
A JSON object contains all the details

Responses

200

logout successfuly

204

no content

400

bad request

401

unauthorized client

403

client doesn't have access

404

user not found

500

server error

Register

Up 
post /register
A new user from client is added to the server (registerPost)
A JSON object contains the user details

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body user (required)
Body Parameter — user added to database

Responses

200

user found

201

New user created

204

no content

400

bad request

401

unauthorized client

403

client doesn't have access

404

user not found

500

server error

UpdateMatchResultsAndEvents

Up 
put /leagueManage/{leagueName}
A union representetive user updating match results and events (leagueManageLeagueNamePut)
A JSON object contains the match details

Path parameters

leagueName (required)
Path Parameter — the name of the league

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body match (required)
Body Parameter — match results and events updated in database

Responses

200

league found

201

match results and events updated

204

no content

400

bad request

401

unauthorized client

403

client doesn't have access

404

user not found

500

server error

Models

[ Jump to Methods ]

Table of Contents

  1. coach
  2. event
  3. league
  4. loginUser
  5. match
  6. player
  7. referee
  8. stadium
  9. team
  10. user

coach Up

Model containing Coach Info
id (optional)
String coach's ID contains at least 5 letters
example: 12345
commonName (optional)
String coach's name contains at least 3 letters
example: ddi
nationality (optional)
String coach's nationality
example: Spain
birthdate (optional)
date coach's birthdate format: date
birthCountry (optional)
String coach's birthCountry
example: Spain
team (optional)
String coach's team
example: Barcelona

event Up

Model containing Event Info
id (optional)
String event's ID contains at least 5 letters
example: 12345
fullName (optional)
String event's name contains at least 3 letters
example: penalty

league Up

Model containing League Info
id (optional)
String League ID contains at least 5 letters
example: 12345
name (optional)
String League name contains at least 2 letters
example: Top league
season (optional)
String League's season name contains at least 1 letters
example: season 20
stage (optional)
String League's stage name contains at least 1 letters
example: stage 20
matches (optional)
array[match] the matches list of the league
example: ["match1","match2","match3"]
teams (optional)
array[team] the teams list of the league
example: ["team1","team2","team3"]
teamsQuantity (optional)
BigDecimal total number of teams in the league
example: 12

loginUser Up

Model containing login user Info
username (optional)
String username contain between 3 to 8 letters only
example: Danidin
password (optional)
String password contains between 5 to 10 chars, at least one of them is a number and a special char format: password
example: joanne@56

match Up

Model containing Match Info
date (optional)
date Match date format: date
time (optional)
String time
example: 15:00
homeTeam (optional)
array[team] the home team object
example: team1
awayTeam (optional)
array[team] the away team object
example: team2
stadium (optional)
array[stadium] the stadium of the match object
example: stadium1
score (optional)
String the score of the match
example: 2:1
events (optional)
array[event] the events of this match
example: ["event1","event2"]
referees (optional)
array[referee] the referees of this match
example: ["referee1","referee2"]

player Up

Model containing player Info
id (optional)
String player's ID contains at least 5 letters
example: 12345
commonName (optional)
String player's name contains at least 3 letters
example: Leo Messi
nationality (optional)
String player's nationality
example: Spain
birthdate (optional)
date player's birthdate format: date
birthCountry (optional)
String player's birthCountry
example: Spain
height (optional)
String player's height
example: 1.90
weight (optional)
String player's weight
example: 75
team (optional)
String player's team
example: Barcelona
position (optional)
BigDecimal player's position
example: 1

referee Up

Model containing Referee Info
id (optional)
String referee's ID contains at least 5 letters
example: 12345
name (optional)
String referee's name contains at least 5 letters
example: dan
league (optional)
array[league] referee's league
example: league1

stadium Up

Model containing Stadium Info
id (optional)
String stadium ID contains at least 5 letters
example: 12345
name (optional)
String stadium name contains at least 3 letters
example: Camp nou
city (optional)
String city name contains at least 3 letters
example: Barcelona
teams (optional)
array[team] the teams play in the stadium
example: ["team1","team2"]

team Up

Model containing team Info
id (optional)
String team ID contains at least 5 letters
example: 12345
name (optional)
String team name contains at least 3 letters
example: Barcelona
players (optional)
array[player] the players list of the team
example: ["player1","player2","player3"]
budget (optional)
BigDecimal total budget of the team
coach (optional)
array[coach] the coach of the team
example: coach1
matches (optional)
array[match] the recent matches list of the team
example: ["match1","match2","match3"]

user Up

Model containing user Info
username (optional)
String username contain between 3 to 8 letters only
example: Danidin
firstname (optional)
String user's first name
example: Daniel
lastname (optional)
String user's last name
example: Goldman
country (optional)
String user's country
example: Israel
password (optional)
String password contains between 5 to 10 chars, at least one of them is a number and a special char format: password
example: joanne@56
email (optional)
String user's email format: email
example: Danidin@gmail.com
imageUrl (optional)
String URL for the user's image format: URL
example: https://cliiudinary.com/ladygaga
players (optional)
array[player] the favorite players list of the user
example: ["player1","player2","player3"]
teams (optional)
array[team] the favorite teams list of the user
example: ["team1","team2","team3"]
matches (optional)
array[match] the favorite matches list of the user
example: ["match1","match2","match3"]
